Job Summary: 
The desire to help people is in your bones: That’s why you are a nurse. Imagine how great it would be to use your skills to help the people who “make the magic” at the happiest place on earth – Walt Disney World! Disney’s state-of-the-art, fully staffed medical clinic is located in the heart of the Parks so that if a fellow Cast Member (that’s what we call co-workers) gets injured or sick, we can give them the fastest, most comprehensive treatment possible. More importantly, we focus on helping our cast improve their overall health and wellbeing. 
 
Our clinics have the fast pace and ever changing case flow as an urgent care clinic, but with a more holistic view of health improvement and not just one time treatments. If you have passion for occupational health and overall health improvement with the energy, talent and desire to join our group, please apply today! 
 
We proudly and happily welcome veterans of the US Armed Forces. 
 
Responsibilities: 
As an experienced registered nurse, most of your responsibilities will be familiar to you – think vital signs, triage, treating illnesses, administering meds, advising how to lead a safe, healthy lifestyle – as well as administrative tasks like collecting data, completing workers’ compensation forms and insuring that all OSHA rules are scrupulously followed. You will make sure the highest standards of quality and confidentiality are met at all times, and will be as precise with your documentation as you are with your hands-on patient work. While you will work a minimum of one weekend day per week, and you may be scheduled on holidays, you will never have to work a “graveyard” shift, and after your training period, you will have two consistent days off per week so you can plan your life. Every day as an Occupational Registered Nurse is different. On any given day, you might: 
Assess Cast Members who present with illness or injury, make a determination of occupational vs. non-occupational mechanism, and perform necessary treatment, per your license 
Perform regulatory-required medical surveillance exams, as indicated by current OHSA standards 
Administer travel immunizations, per physician orders 
Lead/participate in Disney’s Resort Health and Safety programs 
Collaborate with physicians, your fellow nurses and the Wellness Team on a daily basis 
Communicate with doctors, your peers and Health Services leadership on matters that require attention 
Uphold The Walt Disney Company’s standards of business conduct 
Document and maintain accurate, detailed records related to the treatment of Cast Members in accordance with Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA) 
Interact with Worker’s Compensation, Safety and Disney physicians/outside providers to facilitate treatment and process work-related illnesses or injuries 
Quality check all work daily to catch any errors or omissions 
Attend a local continuing education class or go for an additional certification – Disney will not only pay for most approved courses, but will also pay your annual certification fee 
Stroll through the Parks anytime you like using your Gate pass, and enjoy the incredible benefits and perks of being a Disney Cast Member! 
Basic Qualifications: 
Here is what you will need to be successful in the job: 
Minimum. 3+ years Registered Nurse Experience 
Current Florida RN license, current CPR Certification, and physical ability to perform all procedures 
Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills – and compassionate, genuine bedside manner 
Knowledge of OSHA and Worker’s Compensation regulations, record keeping and procedures 
Physical stamina to stand for long periods of time to walk, lift, squat, push, pull and/or carry heavy objects, up to 25 lbs. 
Excellent hearing and ability to see, and full use of hands for patient assessment and to control, handle or feel objects and tools 
Sharp time management skills and deep desire to give the best possible care and patient service 
Willingness and ability to work in a team environment 
Scrupulously protects patient confidentiality 
Flexibility to work on holidays/weekends, as well as occasional overtime 
Knowledge of basic computer programs and ability to work with a laptop/desktop 
Valid Florida driver’s license 
Preferred Qualifications: 
It would be helpful if you also had: 
Experience working in a fast-paced hospital, clinic, or similar environment 
Deep knowledge of EMR or Health Management System 
Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs 
Occupational Health Nursing experience 
Required Education 
Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing is REQUIRED 
Master’s Degree and/or Certified Occupational Health Nurse (XOHN/COHN-S) is preferred 
Preferred Education 
Master’s Degree and/or Certified Occupational Health Nurse (XOHN/COHN-S)
